result.execSummary:
The defendant Keith Rl Martin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(cm)2.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Cocaine (<=1g), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)1g.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Obey all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate.  Follow through with recommendations.  Comply with any child support or paternity orders in effect.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.  Firearm prohibition warning given.

for modification of bond

Ct 1: 961.41(1)(cm)1r-Manuf/Del Cocaine; Ct 2: 961.41(1m)(cm)2-Manuf/Del Cocaine. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
